Raag Bhairao − Part 001 1125 : 1 Raag Bhairao, First Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas: 1125 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 1125 : 3 Without You, nothing happens. 1125 : 4 You create the creatures, and gazing on them, you know them. ||1|| 1125 : 5 What can I say? I cannot say anything. 1125 : 6 Whatever exists, is by Your Will. ||Pause|| 1125 : 7 Whatever is to be done, rests with You. 1125 : 8 Unto whom should I offer my prayer? ||2|| 1125 : 9 I speak and hear the Bani of Your Word. 2

1125 : 10 You Yourself know all Your Wondrous Play. ||3|| 1125 : 11 You Yourself act, and inspire all to act; only You Yourself know. 1125 : 12 Says Nanak, You, Lord, see, establish and disestablish. ||4||1|| 1125 : 13 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1125 : 14 Raag Bhairao, First Mehl, Second House: 1125 : 15 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, so many silent sages have been saved; Indra and Brahma have also been saved. 1125 : 16 Sanak, Sanandan and many humble men of austerity, by Guru's Grace, have been carried across to the other side. ||1|| 1125 : 17 Without the Word of the Shabad, how can anyone cross over the terrifying world−ocean? 1125 : 18 Without the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the world is entangled in the disease of duality, and is drowned, drowned, and dies. ||1||Pause|| 1125 : 19 Raag Bhairao − Part 001 3

The Guru is Divine; the Guru is Inscrutable and Mysterious. Serving the Guru, the three worlds are known and understood. 1125 : 20 The Guru, the Giver, has Himself given me the Gift; I have obtained the Inscrutable, Mysterious Lord. ||2|| 1125 : 21 The mind is the king; the mind is appeased and satisfied through the mind itself, and desire is stilled in the mind. 1125 : 22 The mind is the Yogi, the mind wastes away in separation from the Lord; singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, the mind is instructed and reformed. ||3|| 1125 : 23 How very rare are those in this world who, through the Guru, subdue their minds, and contemplate the Word of the Shabad. 1125 : 24 O Nanak, our Lord and Master is All−pervading; through the True Word of the Shabad, we are emancipated. ||4||1||2|| 1125 : 25 Bhairao, First Mehl: 1125 : 26 The eyes lose their sight, and the body withers away; old age overtakes the mortal, and death hangs over his head. 1125 : 27 Beauty, loving attachment and the pleasures of life are not permanent. How can anyone escape from the noose of death? ||1|| Raag Bhairao − Part 001 4
1125 : 28 O mortal, meditate on the Lord − your life is passing away! −− Raag Bhairao − Part 001 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 001 5

Raag Bhairao − Part 002 1126 : 29 Without the True Word of the Shabad, you shall never be released, and your life shall be totally useless. ||1||Pause|| 1126 : 30 Within the body are sexual desire, anger, egotism and attachment. This pain is so great, and so difficult to endure. 1126 : 31 As Gurmukh, chant the Lord's Name, and savor it with your tongue; in this way, you shall cross over to the other side. ||2|| 1126 : 32 Your ears are deaf, and your intellect is worthless, and still, you do not intuitively understand the Word of the Shabad. 1126 : 33 The self−willed manmukh wastes this priceless human life and loses it. Without the Guru, the blind person cannot see. ||3|| 1126 : 34 Whoever remains detached and free of desire in the midst of desire − and whoever, unattached, intuitively meditates on the Celestial Lord 1126 : 35 − prays Nanak, as Gurmukh, he is released. He is lovingly attuned to the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||4||||2||3|| 1126 : 36 Bhairao, First Mehl: 6

1126 : 37 His walk becomes weak and clumsy, his feet and hands shake, and the skin of his body is withered and wrinkled. 1126 : 38 His eyes are dim, his ears are deaf, and yet, the self−willed manmukh does not know the Naam. ||1|| 1126 : 39 O blind man, what have you obtained by coming into the world? 1126 : 40 The Lord is not in your heart, and you do not serve the Guru. After wasting your capital, you shall have to depart. ||1||Pause|| 1126 : 41 Your tongue is not imbued with the Love of the Lord; whatever you say is tasteless and insipid. 1126 : 42 You indulge in slander of the Saints; becoming a beast, you shall never be noble. ||2|| 1126 : 43 Only a few obtain the sublime essence of the Ambrosial Amrit, united in Union with the True Guru. 1126 : 44 As long as the mortal does not come to understand the mystery of the Shabad, the Word of God, he shall continue to be tormented by death. ||3|| 1126 : 45 Whoever finds the door of the One True Lord, does not know any other house or door. Raag Bhairao − Part 002 7

1126 : 46 By Guru's Grace, I have obtained the supreme status; so says poor Nanak. ||4||3||4|| 1126 : 47 Bhairao, First Mehl: 1126 : 48 He spends the entire night in sleep; the noose is tied around his neck. His day is wasted in worldly entanglements. 1126 : 49 He does not know God, who created this world, for a moment, for even an instant. ||1|| 1126 : 50 O mortal, how will you escape this terrible disaster? 1126 : 51 What did you bring with you, and what will you take away? Meditate on the Lord, the Most Worthy and Generous Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1126 : 52 The heart−lotus of the self−willed manmukh is upside−down; his intellect is shallow; his mind is blind, and his head is entangled in worldly affairs. 1126 : 53 Death and re−birth constantly hang over your head; without the Name, your neck shall be caught in the noose. ||2|| 1126 : 54 Your steps are unsteady, and your eyes are blind; you are not aware of the Word of the Shabad, O Sibling of Destiny. Raag Bhairao − Part 002 8

1126 : 55 The Shaastras and the Vedas keep the mortal bound to the three modes of Maya, and so he performs his deeds blindly. ||3|| 1126 : 56 He loses his capital − how can he earn any profit? The evil−minded person has no spiritual wisdom at all. 1126 : 57 Contemplating the Shabad, he drinks in the sublime essence of the Lord; O Nanak, his faith is confirmed in the Truth. ||4||4||5|| 1126 : 58 Bhairao, First Mehl: 1126 : 59 He remains with the Guru, day and night, and his tongue savors the savory taste of the Lord's Love. 1126 : 60 He does not know any other; he realizes the Word of the Shabad. He knows and realizes the Lord deep within his own being. ||1|| 1126 : 61 Such a humble person is pleasing to my mind. 1126 : 62 He conquers his self−conceit, and is imbued with the Infinite Lord. He serves the Guru. ||1||Pause|| 1126 : 63 Raag Bhairao − Part 002 9

Deep within my being, and outside as well, is the Immaculate Lord God. I bow humbly before that Primal Lord God. 1126 : 64 Deep within each and every heart, and amidst all, the Embodiment of Truth is permeating and pervading. ||2|| −− Raag Bhairao − Part 002 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 002 10

Raag Bhairao − Part 003 1127 : 65 Those who are imbued with Truth − their tongues are tinged with Truth; they do not have even an iota of the filth of falsehood. 1127 : 66 They taste the sweet Ambrosial Nectar of the Immaculate Naam, the Name of the Lord; imbued with the Shabad, they are blessed with honor. ||3|| 1127 : 67 The virtuous meet with the virtuous, and earn the profit; as Gurmukh, they obtain the glorious greatness of the Naam. 1127 : 68 All sorrows are erased, by serving the Guru; O Nanak, the Naam is our only Friend and Companion. ||4||5||6|| 1127 : 69 Bhairao, First Mehl: 1127 : 70 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is the wealth and support of all; It is enshrined in the heart, by Guru's Grace. 1127 : 71 One who gathers this imperishable wealth is fulfilled, and through intuitive meditation, is lovingly focused on the Lord. ||1|| 1127 : 72 O mortal, focus your consciousness on devotional worship of the Lord. 11

1127 : 73 As Gurmukh, meditate on the Name of the Lord in your heart, and you shall return to your home with intuitive ease. ||1||Pause|| 1127 : 74 Doubt, separation and fear are never eradicated, and the mortal continues coming and going in reincarnation, as long as he does not know the Lord. 1127 : 75 Without the Name of the Lord, no one is liberated; they drown and die without water. ||2|| 1127 : 76 Busy with his worldly affairs, all honor is lost; the ignorant one is not rid of his doubts. 1127 : 77 Without the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the mortal is never liberated; he remains blindly entangled in the expanse of worldly affairs. ||3|| 1127 : 78 My mind is pleased and appeased with the Immaculate Lord, who has no ancestry. Through the mind itself, the mind is subdued. 1127 : 79 Deep within my being, and outside as well, I know only the One Lord. O Nanak, there is no other at all. ||4||6||7|| 1127 : 80 Bhairao, First Mehl: 1127 : 81 You may give feasts, make burnt offerings, donate to charity, perform austere penance and worship, and endure pain and suffering in the body. Raag Bhairao − Part 003 12

1127 : 82 But without the Lord's Name, liberation is not obtained. As Gurmukh, obtain the Naam and liberation. ||1|| 1127 : 83 Without the Lord's Name, birth into the world is useless. 1127 : 84 Without the Name, the mortal eats poison and speaks poisonous words; he dies fruitlessly, and wanders in reincarnation. ||1||Pause|| 1127 : 85 The mortal may read scriptures, study grammar and say his prayers three times a day. 1127 : 86 Without the Word of the Guru's Shabad, where is liberation, O mortal? Without the Lord's Name, the mortal is entangled and dies. ||2|| 1127 : 87 Walking sticks, begging bowls, hair tufts, sacred threads, loin cloths, pilgrimages to sacred shrines and wandering all around 1127 : 88 − without the Lord's Name, peace and tranquility are not obtained. One who chants the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, crosses over to the other side. ||3|| 1127 : 89 The mortal's hair may be matted and tangled upon his head, and he may smear his body with ashes; he may take off his clothes and go naked. 1127 : 90 Raag Bhairao − Part 003 13

But without the Lord's Name, he is not satisfied; he wears religious robes, but he is bound by the karma of the actions he committed in past lives. ||4|| 1127 : 91 As many beings and creatures as there are in the water, on the land and in the sky − wherever they are, You are with them all, O Lord. 1127 : 92 By Guru's Grace, please preserve Your humble servant; O Lord, Nanak stirs up this juice, and drinks it in. ||5||7||8|| 1127 : 93 Raag Bhairao, Third Mehl, Chaupadas, First House: 1127 : 94 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1127 : 95 No one should be proud of his social class and status. 1127 : 96 He alone is a Brahmin, who knows God. ||1|| 1127 : 97 Do not be proud of your social class and status, you ignorant fool! −− Raag Bhairao − Part 003 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 003 14

Raag Bhairao − Part 004 1128 : 98 So much sin and corruption comes from this pride. ||1||Pause|| 1128 : 99 Everyone says that there are four castes, four social classes. 1128 : 100 They all emanate from the drop of God's Seed. ||2|| 1128 : 101 The entire universe is made of the same clay. 1128 : 102 The Potter has shaped it into all sorts of vessels. ||3|| 1128 : 103 The five elements join together, to make up the form of the human body. 1128 : 104 Who can say which is less, and which is more? ||4|| 1128 : 105 Says Nanak, this soul is bound by its actions. 1128 : 106 Without meeting the True Guru, it is not liberated. ||5||1|| 15

1128 : 107 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1128 : 108 The Yogis, the householders, the Pandits, the religious scholars, and the beggars in religious robes 1128 : 109 − they are all asleep in egotism. ||1|| 1128 : 110 They are asleep, intoxicated with the wine of Maya. 1128 : 111 Only those who remain awake and aware are not robbed. ||1||Pause|| 1128 : 112 One who has met the True Guru, remains awake and aware. 1128 : 113 Such a person overpowers the five thieves. ||2|| 1128 : 114 One who contemplates the essence of reality remains awake and aware. 1128 : 115 He kills his self−conceit, and does not kill anyone else. ||3|| 1128 : 116 One who knows the One Lord remains awake and aware. Raag Bhairao − Part 004 16

1128 : 117 He abandons the service of others, and realizes the essence of reality. ||4|| 1128 : 118 Of the four castes, whoever remains awake and aware 1128 : 119 is released from birth and death. ||5|| 1128 : 120 Says Nanak, that humble being remains awake and aware, 1128 : 121 who applies the ointment of spiritual wisdom to his eyes. ||6||2|| 1128 : 122 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1128 : 123 Whoever the Lord keeps in His Sanctuary, 1128 : 124 is attached to the Truth, and receives the fruit of Truth. ||1|| 1128 : 125 O mortal, unto whom will you complain? 1128 : 126 The Hukam of the Lord's Command is pervasive; by the Hukam of His Command, all things happen. ||1||Pause|| Raag Bhairao − Part 004 17

1128 : 127 This Creation was established by You. 1128 : 128 In an instant You destroy it, and You create it again without a moment's delay. ||2|| 1128 : 129 By His Grace, He has staged this Play. 1128 : 130 By the Guru's Merciful Grace, I have obtained the supreme status. ||3|| 1128 : 131 Says Nanak, He alone kills and revives. 1128 : 132 Understand this well − do not be confused by doubt. ||4||3|| 1128 : 133 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1128 : 134 I am the bride; the Creator is my Husband Lord. 1128 : 135 As He inspires me, I adorn myself. ||1|| 1128 : 136 When it pleases Him, He enjoys me. Raag Bhairao − Part 004 18

1128 : 137 I am joined, body and mind, to my True Lord and Master. ||1||Pause|| 1128 : 138 How can anyone praise or slander anyone else? 1128 : 139 The One Lord Himself is pervading and permeating all. ||2|| 1128 : 140 By Guru's Grace, I am attracted by His Love. 1128 : 141 I shall meet with my Merciful Lord, and vibrate the Panch Shabad, the Five Primal Sounds. ||3|| 1128 : 142 Prays Nanak, what can anyone do? 1128 : 143 He alone meets with the Lord, whom the Lord Himself meets. ||4||4|| 1128 : 144 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1128 : 145 He alone is a silent sage, who subdues his mind's duality. 1128 : 146 Subduing his duality, he contemplates God. ||1|| Raag Bhairao − Part 004 19

1128 : 147 Let each person examine his own mind, O Siblings of Destiny. 1128 : 148 Examine your mind, and you shall obtain the nine treasures of the Naam. ||1||Pause|| 1128 : 149 The Creator created the world, upon the foundation of worldly love and attachment. 1128 : 150 Attaching it to possessiveness, He has led it into confusion with doubt. ||2|| 1128 : 151 From this Mind come all bodies, and the breath of life. 1128 : 152 By mental contemplation, the mortal realizes the Hukam of the Lord's Command, and merges in Him. ||3|| −− Raag Bhairao − Part 004 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 004 20

Raag Bhairao − Part 005 1129 : 153 When the mortal has good karma, the Guru grants His Grace. 1129 : 154 Then this mind is awakened, and the duality of this mind is subdued. ||4|| 1129 : 155 It is the innate nature of the mind to remain forever detached. 1129 : 156 The Detached, Dispassionate Lord dwells within all. ||5|| 1129 : 157 Says Nanak, one who understands this mystery, 1129 : 158 becomes the embodiment of the Primal, Immaculate, Divine Lord God. ||6||5|| 1129 : 159 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1129 : 160 The world is saved through Name of the Lord. 1129 : 161 It carries the mortal across the terrifying world−ocean. ||1|| 21

1129 : 162 By Guru's Grace, dwell upon the Lord's Name. 1129 : 163 It shall stand by you forever. ||1||Pause|| 1129 : 164 The foolish self−willed manmukhs do not remember the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 1129 : 165 Without the Name, how will they cross over? ||2|| 1129 : 166 The Lord, the Great Giver, Himself gives His Gifts. 1129 : 167 Celebrate and praise the Great Giver! ||3|| 1129 : 168 Granting His Grace, the Lord unites the mortals with the True Guru. 1129 : 169 O Nanak, the Naam is enshrined within the heart. ||4||6|| 1129 : 170 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1129 : 171 All people are saved through the Naam, the Name of the Lord. Raag Bhairao − Part 005 22

1129 : 172 Those who become Gurmukh are blessed to receive It. ||1|| 1129 : 173 When the Dear Lord showers His Mercy, 1129 : 174 He blesses the Gurmukh with the glorious greatness of the Naam. ||1||Pause|| 1129 : 175 Those who love the Beloved Name of the Lord 1129 : 176 save themselves, and save all their ancestors. ||2|| 1129 : 177 Without the Name, the self−willed manmukhs go to the City of Death. 1129 : 178 They suffer in pain and endure beatings. ||3|| 1129 : 179 When the Creator Himself gives, 1129 : 180 O Nanak, then the mortals receive the Naam. ||4||7|| 1129 : 181 Bhairao, Third Mehl: Raag Bhairao − Part 005 23

1129 : 182 Love of the Lord of the Universe saved Sanak and his brother, the sons of Brahma. 1129 : 183 They contemplated the Word of the Shabad, and the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 1129 : 184 O Dear Lord, please shower me with Your Mercy, 1129 : 185 that as Gurmukh, I may embrace love for Your Name. ||1||Pause|| 1129 : 186 Whoever has true loving devotional worship deep within his being 1129 : 187 meets the Lord, through the Perfect Guru. ||2|| 1129 : 188 He naturally, intuitively dwells within the home of his own inner being. 1129 : 189 The Naam abides within the mind of the Gurmukh. ||3|| 1129 : 190 The Lord, the Seer, Himself sees. 1129 : 191 O Nanak, enshrine the Naam within your heart. ||4||8|| Raag Bhairao − Part 005 24

1129 : 192 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1129 : 193 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, enshrine the Lord's Name within your heart. 1129 : 194 Without the Name, ashes will be blown in your face. ||1|| 1129 : 195 The Lord's Name is so difficult to obtain, O Siblings of Destiny. 1129 : 196 By Guru's Grace, it comes to dwell in the mind. ||1||Pause|| 1129 : 197 That humble being who seeks the Lord's Name, 1129 : 198 receives it from the Perfect Guru. ||2|| 1129 : 199 Those humble beings who accept the Will of the Lord, are approved and accepted. 1129 : 200 Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, they bear the insignia of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||3|| 1129 : 201 So serve the One, whose power supports the Universe. Raag Bhairao − Part 005 25

1129 : 202 O Nanak, the Gurmukh loves the Naam. ||4||9|| 1129 : 203 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1129 : 204 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, many rituals are performed. 1129 : 205 But it is not the time for them, and so they are of no use. ||1|| 1129 : 206 In Kali Yuga, the Lord's Name is the most sublime. 1129 : 207 As Gurmukh, be lovingly attached to Truth. ||1||Pause|| 1129 : 208 Searching my body and mind, I found Him within the home of my own heart. 1129 : 209 The Gurmukh centers his consciousness on the Lord's Name. ||2|| −− Raag Bhairao − Part 005 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 005 26

Raag Bhairao − Part 006 1130 : 210 The ointment of spiritual wisdom is obtained from the True Guru. 1130 : 211 The Lord's Name is pervading the three worlds. ||3|| 1130 : 212 In Kali Yuga, it is the time for the One Dear Lord; it is not the time for anything else. 1130 : 213 O Nanak, as Gurmukh, let the Lord's Name grow within your heart. ||4||10|| 1130 : 214 Bhairao, Third Mehl, Second House: 1130 : 215 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1130 : 216 The self−willed manmukhs are afflicted with the disease of duality; they are burnt by the intense fire of desire. 1130 : 217 They die and die again, and are reborn; they find no place of rest. They waste their lives uselessly. ||1|| 1130 : 218 O my Beloved, grant Your Grace, and give me understanding. 27

1130 : 219 The world was created in the disease of egotism; without the Word of the Shabad, the disease is not cured. ||1||Pause|| 1130 : 220 There are so many silent sages, who read the Simritees and the Shaastras; without the Shabad, they have no clear awareness. 1130 : 221 All those under the influence of the three qualities are afflicted with the disease; through possessiveness, they lose their awareness. ||2|| 1130 : 222 O God, you save some, and you enjoin others to serve the Guru. 1130 : 223 They obtain the treasure of the Name of the Lord; peace comes to abide within their minds. ||3|| 1130 : 224 The Gurmukhs dwell in the fourth state; they obtain a dwelling in the home of their own inner being. 1130 : 225 The Perfect True Guru shows His Mercy to them; they eradicate their self−conceit from within. ||4|| 1130 : 226 Everyone must serve the One Lord, who created Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva. 1130 : 227 Raag Bhairao − Part 006 28

O Nanak, the One True Lord is permanent and stable. He does not die, and He is not born. ||5||1||11|| 1130 : 228 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1130 : 229 The self−willed manmukh is afflicted with the disease of duality forever; the entire universe is diseased. 1130 : 230 The Gurmukh understands, and is cured of the disease, contemplating the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||1|| 1130 : 231 O Dear Lord, please let me join the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation. 1130 : 232 O Nanak, the Lord blesses with glorious greatness, those who focus their consciousness on the Lord's Name. ||1||Pause|| 1130 : 233 Death takes all those who are afflicted with the disease of possessiveness. They are subject to the Messenger of Death. 1130 : 234 The Messenger of Death does not even approach that mortal who, as Gurmukh, enshrines the Lord within his heart. ||2|| 1130 : 235 One who does not know the Lord's Name, and who does not become Gurmukh − why did he even come into the world? Raag Bhairao − Part 006 29

1130 : 236 He never serves the Guru; he wastes his life uselessly. ||3|| 1130 : 237 O Nanak, those whom the True Guru enjoins to His service, have perfect good fortune. 1130 : 238 They obtain the fruits of their desires, and find peace in the Word of the Guru's Bani. ||4||2||12|| 1130 : 239 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1130 : 240 In pain he is born, in pain he dies, and in pain he does his deeds. 1130 : 241 He is never released from the womb of reincarnation; he rots away in manure. ||1|| 1130 : 242 Cursed, cursed is the self−willed manmukh, who wastes his life away. 1130 : 243 He does not serve the Perfect Guru; he does not love the Name of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1130 : 244 The Word of the Guru's Shabad cures all diseases; he alone is attached to it, whom the Dear Lord attaches. −− Raag Bhairao − Part 006 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 006 30

Raag Bhairao − Part 007 1131 : 245 Through the Naam, glorious greatness is obtained; he alone obtains it, whose mind is filled with the Lord. ||2|| 1131 : 246 Meeting the True Guru, the fruitful rewards are obtained. This true lifestyle beings sublime peace. 1131 : 247 Those humble beings who are attached to the Lord are immaculate; they enshrine love for the Lord's Name. ||3|| 1131 : 248 If I obtain the dust of their feet, I apply it to my forehead. They meditate on the Perfect True Guru. 1131 : 249 O Nanak, this dust is obtained only by perfect destiny. They focus their consciousness on the Lord's Name. ||4||3||13|| 1131 : 250 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1131 : 251 That humble being who contemplates the Word of the Shabad is true; the True Lord is within his heart. 1131 : 252 If someone performs true devotional worship day and night, then his body will not feel pain. ||1|| 31

1131 : 253 Everyone calls him, "Devotee, devotee." 1131 : 254 But without serving the True Guru, devotional worship is not obtained. Only through perfect destiny does one meet God. ||1||Pause|| 1131 : 255 The self−willed manmukhs lose their capital, and still, they demand profits. How can they earn any profit? 1131 : 256 The Messenger of Death is always hovering above their heads. In the love of duality, they lose their honor. ||2|| 1131 : 257 Trying on all sorts of religious robes, they wander around day and night, but the disease of their egotism is not cured. 1131 : 258 Reading and studying, they argue and debate; attached to Maya, they lose their awareness. ||3|| 1131 : 259 Those who serve the True Guru are blessed with the supreme status; through the Naam, they are blessed with glorious greatness. 1131 : 260 O Nanak, those whose minds are filled with the Naam, are honored in the Court of the True Lord. ||4||4||14|| 1131 : 261 Raag Bhairao − Part 007 32

Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1131 : 262 The self−willed manmukh cannot escape false hope. In the love of duality, he is ruined. 1131 : 263 His belly is like a river − it is never filled up. He is consumed by the fire of desire. ||1|| 1131 : 264 Eternally blissful are those who are imbued with the sublime essence of the Lord. 1131 : 265 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, fills their hearts, and duality runs away from their minds. Drinking in the Ambrosial Nectar of the Lord, Har, Har, they are satisfied. ||1||Pause|| 1131 : 266 The Supreme Lord God Himself created the Universe; He links each and every person to their tasks. 1131 : 267 He Himself created love and attachment to Maya; He Himself attaches the mortals to duality. ||2|| 1131 : 268 If there were any other, then I would speak to him; all will be merged in You. 1131 : 269 The Gurmukh contemplates the essence of spiritual wisdom; his light merges into the Light. ||3|| 1131 : 270 Raag Bhairao − Part 007 33

God is True, Forever True, and all His Creation is True. 1131 : 271 O Nanak, the True Guru has given me this understanding; the True Name brings emancipation. ||4||5||15|| 1131 : 272 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1131 : 273 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, those who do not realize the Lord are goblins. In the Golden Age of Sat Yuga, the supreme soul−swans contemplated the Lord. 1131 : 274 In the Silver Age of Dwaapur Yuga, and the Brass Age of Traytaa Yuga, mankind prevailed, but only a rare few subdued their egos. ||1|| 1131 : 275 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, glorious greatness is obtained through the Lord's Name. 1131 : 276 In each and every age, the Gurmukhs know the One Lord; without the Name, liberation is not attained. ||1||Pause|| 1131 : 277 The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is revealed in the heart of the True Lord's humble servant. It dwells in the mind of the Gurmukh. 1131 : 278 Those who are lovingly focused on the Lord's Name save themselves; they save all their ancestors as well. ||2|| Raag Bhairao − Part 007 34
1131 : 279 My Lord God is the Giver of virtue. The Word of the Shabad burns away all faults and demerits. −− Raag Bhairao − Part 007 −− Raag Bhairao − Part 007 35

Raag Bhairao − Part 008 1132 : 280 Those whose minds are filled with the Naam are beautiful; they enshrine the Naam within their hearts. ||3|| 1132 : 281 The True Guru has revealed to me the Lord's Home and His Court, and the Mansion of His Presence. I joyfully enjoy His Love. 1132 : 282 Whatever He says, I accept as good; Nanak chants the Naam. ||4||6||16|| 1132 : 283 Bhairao, Third Mehl: 1132 : 284 The desires of the mind are absorbed in the mind, contemplating the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 1132 : 285 Understanding is obtained from the Perfect Guru, and then the mortal does not die over and over again. ||1|| 1132 : 286 My mind takes the Support of the Lord's Name. 1132 : 287 By Guru's Grace, I have obtained the supreme status; the Lord is the Fulfiller of all desires. ||1||Pause|| 36
